div.p:
Would you be so very kind, dear Mr M'Pherson, to give me an opportunity to attend at the next meeting of the trustees of the industrial Museum, in order that I may explain my views in reference to the phytological collections to be formed and arranged as a section of the Museum, and that some professional control may be allowed to me in reference to this section. As I am not a trustee nor an officer of the public Library, I should gladly arrange some plan of working with the trustees, and thus prevent sinking to a position below the dignity, which I departmentally and scientifically occupy, a dignity which I trust will be recognized.
On 14 May 1870, MacPherson minuted: 'Will the Chairman of the Committee be good enough to bring the request of Dr Mueller before the Committee at its next sitting'.
